content: wolfie s mitts inspired by the movie amadeus these are wolfie s mitts that unforgettable iconic infectious laugh wolfie was ever joyful elegant flamboyant over-the-top and glamorous as all get out these mitts are reminiscent of beautiful velvet and brocade coats with ruffled edges of sleeves peeking out from beneath this simple lace portion is both written and charted the pattern is written for magic loop but can easily be adapted for dpns please do not copy distribute or sell this pattern in any form © grace anne knits 2025 to determine your size wrap a flexible measuring tape around your hand below the knuckles excluding your thumb sizes tiny 7 0 smallish 7 5 larger 8 0 materials tiny fingering yarn mc 75 yards us 2 2 75mm circular needle 32 inches cc 20 yards lace weight cc2 40 yards smallish sport/dk yarn mc 200 yards us 4 3 5mm circular needle 32 inches cc 60 yards fingering cc2 70 yards larger worsted yarn mc 220 yards us 6 4 0mm circular needle 32 inches cc 70 yards sport/dk cc2 90 yards notions 1 locking stitch marker 4 additional markers waste yarn and tapestry needle to weave in ends abbreviations co - cast on using the backward loop method k - knit k1tbl - knit 1 through the back loop kfb - knit into the front and back of the same stitch cc - contrasting color braid cc2 - second contrasting color ruffle mc - main color p - purl pm - place marker sm - slip marker sk2p - slip next st knitwise knit 2 sts together pass slipped stitch over st s - stitch es yo - yarn over this pattern is for private use only it may not be copied sold or otherwise distributed you also cannot sell any items produced in accordance with the instructions contained in this pattern without first contacting the author of the pattern 1 wolfie s mitts are reminiscent of mozart s beautiful velvet and brocade coats with ruffled edges of sleeves peeking out construction for the cuff and wrist is the same for both hands beginning with twisted ribbing and 3 latvian braids instructions are included for a shorter gauntlet lace encircles the wrist and is worked from row 1 24 of the chart or written instructions at this point the hand/thumb mirror one another with lace being knit on the back of the hand and stockinette on the palm with thumb shaping the 4th latvian braid transitions to the ruffle and lastly the final bit of ribbing cast on with mc cast on 48 sts using a stretchy cast on method and divide evenly onto needle 1 and needle 2 being careful not to twist prepare to join and work in the round place a unique stitch marker to indicate the beginning of the round cuff twisted ribbing rounds 1 - 12 with mc k1tbl p1 to end to shorten the gauntlet work 10 rounds of twisted ribbing then
